# src:*/src/support/mtx_rw.c
# The race here is fine, but TSAN has no way to know. Imagine two threads,
# one in __wt_readlock and one in __wt_read_unlock. The read lock is doing
# `old.u.v = l->u.v`, while the write thread is doing the atomic CAS on
# l->u.v. The read thread doesn't have a lock/mutex/whatever protecting the
# read, but it's only saving the value in l->u.v so it can do a later CAS.
#
# __wt_try_readlock has the same (non-)issue as __wt_readlock: the read of
# l->u.v is simply done to have an "expected" value to pass into the CAS.
fun:__wt_readlock
fun:__wt_readunlock
fun:__wt_try_readlock
